subject: Philosophy
title: Existential Projects
description: A micro-lesson that makes Existential Projects usable.

hook.text: Sartre said your life is a project â€” not a thing, but a continuous act of becoming.

buildup.text: You're never finished. Each day you add to the project of who you are through your actions.

discovery.text: Your project gives direction without a fixed destination. It's the thread connecting your choices.

twist.text: But projects can be abandoned or changed. The freedom that created them can also destroy them.

climax.text: There's no final version of you. The project continues until it doesn't â€” and that's its beauty.

punchline.text: You're not a thing. You're a work in progress.

quiz.question: What did Sartre mean by calling life a 'project'?
options: Life is a continuous process of becoming through choices
